Package org.example.GUI.ui

Class MenuButton

java.lang.Object
org.example.GUI.ui.MenuButton
public class MenuButton extends Object
Represents a button used in the menu interface.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructs a MenuButton with the specified position, row index, and game state.

  • Constructor Details

    • MenuButton

      public MenuButton(int xPos, int yPos, int rowIndex, GameState state)
      Constructs a MenuButton with the specified position, row index, and game state.
      Parameters:
      xPos - The x-coordinate of the button.
      yPos - The y-coordinate of the button.
      rowIndex - The row index of the button's sprite in the sprite atlas.
      state - The game state associated with the button.

  • Method Details

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics g)
      Draws the button.
      Parameters:
      g - The Graphics object.

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the button's state based on mouse interaction.

    • isMouseOver

      public boolean isMouseOver()
      Checks if the mouse is over the button.
      Returns:
      True if the mouse is over the button, false otherwise.

    • setMouseOver

      public void setMouseOver(boolean mouseOver)
      Sets the mouse over state of the button.
      Parameters:
      mouseOver - True to set the mouse over state, false otherwise.

    • isMousePressed

      public boolean isMousePressed()
      Checks if the button is pressed.
      Returns:
      True if the button is pressed, false otherwise.

    • setMousePressed

      public void setMousePressed(boolean mousePressed)
      Sets the pressed state of the button.
      Parameters:
      mousePressed - True to set the pressed state, false otherwise.

      Retrieves the bounding rectangle of the button.

      public void resetBools()
      Resets the mouse over and pressed states of the button.
